headline: What the Big Oil executives told Trump about investing in Venezuela
summary: The CEOs of Exxon and Conoco are wary of returning to Venezuela. Chevron is ready to quickly ramp up production.

headline: Reintroducing An Old Divide: State-Owned Vs. Market-Owned Capitalism
summary: In a world where EM are no longer just catch-up stories but laboratories of technological & business model evolution, ex-SOE framework separates engines of progress from machinery of policy.

headline: Trump to Big Oil: Spend $100 Billion in Venezuela. No Government Cash.
summary: President Donald Trump told big oil companies like  Chevron Exxon Mobil  and  ConocoPhillips  that he expects them to spend heavily to rebuild Venezuela’s oil industry, and that they shouldn’t expect financial support from the government.  “The plan is for them to spend—meaning our giant oil companies will be spending at least $100 billion of their money, not the government’s money,” Trump said.

raw.headline: Trump to Big Oil: Spend $100 Billion in Venezuela. No Government Cash.
raw.summary: President Donald Trump told big oil companies like  Chevron Exxon Mobil  and  ConocoPhillips  that he expects them to spend heavily to rebuild Venezuela’s oil industry, and that they shouldn’t expect financial support from the government.  “The plan is for them to spend—meaning our giant oil companies will be spending at least $100 billion of their money, not the government’s money,” Trump said.

headline: Exxon Calls Venezuela ‘Uninvestable’ as Trump Pushes Oil Plan
summary: Trump convened nearly 20 industry representatives in the East Room of the White House Friday and predicted they could come to an agreement “today or very shortly thereafter” to reinvigorate operations in the oil-rich Latin American country following the brazen capture of leader Nicolás Maduro.  “If you don’t want to go in, just let me know, because I’ve got 25 people that aren’t here today that are willing to take your place,” Trump told the executives.  While many praised Trump and said they relished the opportunity in Venezuela, they stressed that hard work remained before they could make substantive investments.

raw.headline: Exxon Calls Venezuela ‘Uninvestable’ as Trump Pushes Oil Plan
raw.summary: Trump convened nearly 20 industry representatives in the East Room of the White House Friday and predicted they could come to an agreement “today or very shortly thereafter” to reinvigorate operations in the oil-rich Latin American country following the brazen capture of leader Nicolás Maduro.  “If you don’t want to go in, just let me know, because I’ve got 25 people that aren’t here today that are willing to take your place,” Trump told the executives.  While many praised Trump and said they relished the opportunity in Venezuela, they stressed that hard work remained before they could make substantive investments.

headline: Trump pushes for $100 billion in oil investments in Venezuela while Exxon and others say it’s currently ‘uninvestable’ without major reforms
summary: Oil giants tell Trump they need stability and considerable legal and political reforms before investing big in Venezuela.

raw.headline: Trump pushes for $100 billion in oil investments in Venezuela while Exxon and others say it’s currently ‘uninvestable’ without major reforms
raw.summary: Oil giants tell Trump they need stability and considerable legal and political reforms before investing big in Venezuela.
